means: （在意义、价值、效果、程度等方面）等于

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词均有"总数，总量"之意。
means: quantity ： 书面用词，指事物的总量和总数量，侧重大批计量，含准确测量的意味。
近义，但强调整体，指把所有数量、重量及度量归并在一起得出的总数。
number ： 普通用词，指人或物的数目，强调数的概念。
sum ： 普通用词，指简单加算的结果。

sentence.Network_en: They have only a vague idea of the amount of water available.
sentence.Network_cn: 他们只是大概知道可用水的总量。

sentence.Network_en: The evaluation of conduct involves some amount of generalization.
sentence.Network_cn: 对操行的评价会含有一些泛泛之论。

sentence.Network_en: They will need a reasonable amount of desk area and good light.
sentence.Network_cn: 他们将需要一个面积较大的摆放办公桌的地方和充足的照明。

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English  (as a verb): from Old French amunter, from amont 'upward', literally 'uphill', from Latin ad montem. The noun use dates from the early 18th cent

encyclopedia.content: amount a.mount [ə`maJnt; əˋmaunt] 不及物动词 1 总计 [某一数字] ,共计，共达，计为[to] The fire loss ~ed to one thousand dollars. 这次火灾损失共达一千美元 2 相当于[…],等于[…][to] His answer ~s to a refusal. 他的回答等于拒绝 名词 1 [the ~]总计，总额[of] (→ sum 【同义字】) She could only spend half the ~. 她只能花费总额的半数 2 (C) 数量，额 (cf. number) a large ~ of money 庞大的

entry.def: The amount of something is how much there is, or how much you have, need, or get.

example.ex: He needs that amount of money to survive...
example.tran: 他需要那样一笔钱以生存下去。

example.ex: I still do a certain amount of work for them...
example.tran: 我仍然为他们做一些工作。

entry.def: If something amounts to a particular total, all the parts of it add up to that total.

example.ex: Consumer spending on sports-related items amounted to £9.75 billion.
example.tran: 消费者在体育相关产品上的花费共计97.5亿英镑。

entry.def: If you say that there is any amount of something, there is a lot of it. If you say that there are any amount of people or things, there are many people or things.

example.ex: I'm able to lay my hands on any amount of cash at a minute's notice...
example.tran: 多少钱我都可以马上弄到。

example.ex: There are any amount of clubs you could join.
example.tran: 有无数个俱乐部你可以加入。

means.word_mean: 1. how much of something is available;

sentences.sentence: "an adequate amount of food for four people"
"the amount he had in cash was insufficient"

means.word_mean: 3. how much there is of something that you can quantify
2. add up in number or quantity;

sentences.sentence: "This idea will never amount to anything"

auth_sentence.res_content: Pour over a generous amount of gravy and serve.

auth_sentence.content: Everyone's fired a certain amount, he said.

stems_affixes.value_cn: 不能克服的,难以对付的
stems_affixes.word_buile: in不+surmount克服+able可以……的→不能克服的
para类似+mount登上,山,安装→类似高山→最高的
mounte=mount登上+bank=bench→登上长椅[卖假药]→江湖骗子
dis去,下+mount登上,山,安装→从[马上]下来
re重新+mount登上,山,安装→再次登上

Sentence.sentence: The amount of sleep that each person needs varies.
The amount of sleep for each person is similar
The residents are billed by "net metering": they pay for the amount of power they tap off the grid, less the kilowatts (千瓦) they feed into it.
So we have a great amount of time for leisure than in decades past.
Furthermore, this figure does not reflect the fact that large amounts of land, energy, fertilisers and water have also been lost in the production of foodstuffs which simply end up as waste.

The average amount of time students now take to complete an undergraduate degree has stretched to six years and seven months as students interrupted by work, inconvenienced by unavailable classes, or lured by one more football season find it hard to graduate

sentences.en: Large amounts of money were wasted.
He owed me ￡１００ but could pay only half that amount.
sentences.cn: 他欠我100英镑, 但是只能偿还总数的一半。

sentences.en: His words amounted to a threat.

means.word_mean: (在意义、价值、效果、程度等方面)等于，相当于，等同；近于，接近，就是，意思是(to)

sentences.en: His failure to reply amounts to a refusal.
sentences.cn: 他不予回答就等于拒绝。

sentences.en: It was the computer that amounted.
sentences.cn: 真正有价值的还是那台电脑。

jushi.english: Food was provided in varying amounts.
jushi.chinese: 食物的供应量变化不定。

jushi.english: He could not pay the full amount he owed.
jushi.chinese: 他偿还不起他所欠的全部债款。

jushi.english: Your information is large in amount but poor in quality.
